data.title: Julius's code
data.statement:
Caesar code is a shift code that was used by Julius Caesar for his private correspondence.
Given a number {{N}} for the shift number, and a string {{S}} for the encoded message, he could decode the text.
The Julius code is similar but, unlike it, characters in an <<odd index>> are shifted by {{-N}} and characters in an <<even index>> are shifted by {{+N}}, <<0 is considered even>>.
If the shifted character is outside the alphabet, we go back to the beginning (or the end)

ex: Y + 3 => B
B - 3 => Y

<<Exercise is case sensitive>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Caesar code is a shift code that was used by Julius Caesar for his private correspondence.
Given a number N for the shift number, and a string S for the encoded message, he could decode the text.
The Julius code is similar but, unlike it, characters in an odd index are shifted by -N and characters in an even index are shifted by +N, 0 is considered even.
If the shifted character is outside the alphabet, we go back to the beginning (or the end)

ex: Y + 3 => B
B - 3 => Y

Exercise is case sensitive
Input
N: the shift number
S: the encoded message
Output
T: the decoded message
Constraints
1≤N≤25
String S will only contain upper/lowercase letters and spaces.
Example
Input
1
ABC
Output
BAD
